intro: Poecilocnemis minarum, commonly known as the Mexican leafhopper, is a small insect belonging to the family Cicadellidae. It is native to Mexico and is often found on plants in the genus Euphorbia. The plant's botanical significance lies in its role as a host for this leafhopper, which feeds on its sap. The species is characterized by its slender body and distinctive coloration, which can vary depending on the host plant. Due to its specific host preferences, it plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
